original_title: China remains a true friend to Sri Lanka: Defence Secretary
original_body_lines: Defence Secretary, General (Rtd.) Kamal Gunaratne expressed his gratitude towards China for being a steadfast ally to Sri Lanka.

“When baseless allegations were raised on the international platform, China remained a true friend, standing shoulder to shoulder with us, and providing us with the necessary understanding and backing,” he said speaking at a ceremony to commemorate the 96th anniversary of the founding of the People's Liberation Army of China.
He highlighted the strong diplomatic ties between the two nations and the cooperation in various fields, particularly in defence and security.
“Both Sri Lanka and China share a commitment to peace and stability in the region and the world,” he said.

Gen. Gunaratne emphasized the vital role played by the armed forces of both countries in upholding this commitment, ensuring the safety of their respective people, and contributing to regional and global security.
During the event, the Chief Guest Defence Secretary Gen. Gunaratne, and Chithrani Gunaratne were received by the Chinese Ambassador, Qi Zhenhong.

Gen. Gunaratne acknowledged China's determination to safeguard its sovereignty and promote regional stability, as evidenced by the remarkable journey of the People's Liberation Army from its inception to its current form as a modern and formidable force.
Furthermore, he expressed gratitude to China for its solidarity and assistance during the conflict in Sri Lanka.
“China's unwavering commitment to the nation's well-being played a pivotal role in the journey towards peace and stability,” he said.
